    • isValidEmployeeEmail

      public static boolean isValidEmployeeEmail(String email)
      We are using a Regex to check if the email is valid employee email. The Regex is: ^[A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+@johannesfog.dk$ The first part before the @ means that the email can contain letters, numbers, +, _, . and -. The second part after the @ means that the email must end with @johannesfog.dk
      Parameters:
      email - The email to check
      Returns:
      True if the email is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidCustomerEmail

      public static boolean isValidCustomerEmail(String email)
      We are using a Regex to check if the email is valid customer email. The Regex is: ^[A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+@([A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+\\.)+[A-Za-z]+$ The first part before the @ means that the email can contain letters, numbers, +, _, . and -. The second part after the @ means that the email must contain letters, numbers, +, _, . and -. The third part after the . means that the email must end with letters.
      Parameters:
      email - The email to check
      Returns:
      True if the email is valid, false otherwise
